title: Manage Aircraft Airworthiness Records
description: A records administrator is responsible for maintaining the complete and compliant set of maintenance and airworthiness records for an aircraft.

tasks.description: Receive and file all incoming maintenance logbook entries, work orders, and component repair certifications.
tasks.expected_outcome: Agent correctly files all new records.

tasks.description: Audit the records to ensure compliance with all applicable regulations and to track life-limited parts.
tasks.expected_outcome: Agent performs an audit and confirms all records are complete and all life-limited parts are tracked.

tasks.description: Prepare a records package for an upcoming sale or lease transfer of the aircraft.
tasks.expected_outcome: Agent compiles a complete and organized set of records for the transaction.
